sub_topic: Prove that the intersection of a set and its complement is the empty set.
message_1: Let set A be {1,2,3,4,5} and set B be the complement of set A. Find the intersection of set A and set B.
message_2:
The complement of set A, denoted as B or A', contains all the elements that are not in set A. Since set A contains the elements {1, 2, 3, 4, 5}, set B contains all the other elements except these.

The intersection of set A and set B, denoted as A ∩ B, contains all the elements that are common to both sets. Since set B contains all the elements that are not in set A, there are no common elements between set A and set B.

Therefore, the intersection of set A and set B is an empty set, denoted as ∅ or {}.
